label: -60° Decline
short_description: Extreme decline. Usually requires locking the legs in. Maximum lower chest isolation.

label: 0° Flat
short_description: Perfectly horizontal. PRESS_FLAT and FLY_FLAT home base.

label: 15° Incline
short_description: One notch up on the bench. Shifts tension to the clavicular head without engaging front delts yet.

label: 30° Incline
short_description: Two notches up. Upper chest reaches near-peak activation.

label: 45° Incline
short_description: True standard incline. Even split of upper chest and front delt. PRESS_INCLINE home base.

label: 60° Incline
short_description: Steep incline. Front delts officially take over as the primary mover.

label: 75° Incline
short_description: High incline. Almost entirely front delts. PRESS_HIGH_INCLINE home base.

label: 90° Upright
short_description: Dead vertical. Removes chest from the press entirely. PRESS_OVERHEAD home base.
